content.description: This route ascends the steep grey face to an easier corner system.
content.location: This is just to the Right of Asphalt Jungle.

content.description: This climbs up and trend left through shallow slightly overhanging corner using small pockets and seams.  Anchors up up and left once you gain the ledge.
content.location: Located 5 feet to the left of Delmar Line.

content.description:
NOTE: This route is currently under construction.

 Warning: Some cleaning required.

 Route is found in the center of the City Limit Wall and starts below a small roof. Traverse up and slightly right to gain a rest stance at the base of the open, right-facing dihedral. Follow the feature up.
content.location: Route is found in the center of the City Limit Wall and starts below a small roof.

content.description:
NOTE: Route currently under construction but bound to be another classic!

 Warning: Route off limits during construction. Some cleaning required. Bolted by Marcus Floyd
content.location: Center of the City Limit Wall, find the slightly overhanging start that follows the bolt line over a small roof and converts to a steep slab with minimal holds.

content.description: This route climbs the steep face to a small roof then cuts left at the second bolt.    Climb into the shallow dihedral and then make technical moves up the right wall of that dihedral.   Finishes at the Rush Hour anchors.
content.location: Starts just left of Rush Hour and right of the tree stump.

content.description: This is a short and steep line with awesome cracks.  If only it were longer!
content.location: First route on the wall as you approach the wall from the Dog Walk.

content.description: On the far left hand side of the City Limit Wall, start below the C-shaped, shallow dihedral, then follow it up to a small roof to find the crux. Once you have clipped the rap anchors, you have passed the hard part so enjoy the view of the river and remember to thank your belayer.
content.location: Far south end of the bluff line, on the left side of the City Limit Wall. Route is left of the large scoop in the wall.

content.description: This route ascends a shallow corner to a left trending seam.   Easier terrain leads to a cruxy bulge near the top.   DONT blow the 2nd clip!
content.location: Located just left of Suburban Dreams.

content.description:
Morning sun with afternoon shade, this wall section can be a great place to stay cool during the summer days.*Note: We are currently cleaning this wall section. Please announce yourself while hiking and be aware of trail signs, posted warnings, and always wear a helmet.The City Limits Wall is at the southern edge of the Robinson Bluff property and can be identified by the large scoop-shaped hole, centered in the left end of the wall. Expect sun during the morning to mid day, during the winter, when the leaves are on the ground. "C is for Cookie" is the first bolted line on the far left hand side of the exposure and follows a C-shaped shallow dihedral most of the way up the route.

Routes range from 30 ft to 65 ft tall and currently provide a small range of difficulty levels (range from 5.9 to 5.11). Work in progress.

Please provide feedback

using your MP App. Star rating and rate difficulty feedback helps the next visitors use the app.
